Veronica's class was very interesting and served as an excellent second writing class and also a nice art criticism introduction class. Group/class discussion with some lecture and microwritings were a typical class but it never got boring or repetitive. Veronica cared about our writing projects and would offer helpful feedback if asked. Recommend.

Nothing but positive things to say about Veronica. If you need ANYTHING she will help you. She is very fair in grading and her abilities and intelligence when it comes to the subject matter is obvious; you care because she cares. Exceptional instructor.
Great second writing class.Focus on class discussion and breaks up the class period with different teaching techniques. Very nice and easy-going.

Tim is awesome! He is so nice and helpful and is always willing to listen to you if you need something or need to talk to him about something. He's a great TA, and another great perk is that he's pretty attractive.

LOVED Tim....I highly recommend his class. He is a reallly really cool guy and he knows what ehs talking about. He is always willing to help you with ideas for projects. He gives a lot of feedbak on the projects too which I loved. Definitely try to get him for Art 300.02!
Ash is a great guy, an excellent teacher, and someone who truly cares about humanity. Thank god he talked about exactly how wrong war is. We should all be talking about it.

Would talk about anything but how to use a camera. He felt like it was our duty to learn it on our own. His grading on the assignment was very biased. If he doesn't like you then be ready to have low grades.

This guy is just super annoying and weird.  He used to rant just about  every class about the war and how wrong we were to be in it therefore he would take up about 30-45 minutes of class with his BS.  Therefore I learned nothing about how to properly operate a camera and take good professional pictures.  He was always flirting w/ this one girl too

She is blatantly rude and treats everyone like children saying things like "No, it's not your turn to ask me questions right now". She seems to think that everyone is an art major and we have hours to devote to the class when it is a GEC for most. It's the end of the semester and I still don't know what my grade is. Unorganized to say the least.

For being an INTRO to ceramics class this woman sure expects a lot. She shoots down ideas until you do what she wants. She is very rude, sarcastic and not very helpful. We were assigned new assignments without even finishing other ones. She also treats her class like kindergartners.Class would have been 100X better if she wasn't the instructor.

Carolyn is an awesome professor! She is extremely helpful about everything. She's always willing to come in on the weekends to help with projects. It is apparent that she is very knowledgable in ceramics. Overall a fabulous professor.
Carolyn is very informative and helpful. She has a strange way of letting you know whether or not she likes your art and can come off as rude. Other than that she is a good professor. have fun
The class was easy enough if you completed assignments with at least some degree of creativity.

This class is easy as long as you pay attention. There's a lab and a lecture portion. Exams are based on info from the lectures, and there are projects every couple of weeks. Crystal is nice, but doesn't try to be your friend. Try and you'll do fine in this class.

He doesn't give back any grades until the end of the semester  and is the most vague professor I have ever encountered. He is completely unable to relay his expectations of the students and gets frustrated over misunderstandings. Would not recommend. Ever.

Tim gives projects a week before they were due (including our final project)  and gives vague directions. He seems to also go from being very supportive and helpful one minute to not caring about you, which leaves you confused. Tim also never hands back grades.

Tim do not care if you are there or not, which means you will be really free to come and leave. Only thing is that you must prepare for each project, because there only few projects, each of them are important. It is not so easy to get a A grade from his critic.

Sean is a very kind teacher who cares a lot about art, but he does not criticize your work a lot, so he can misleading on if you are doing a good job. He grades your portfolios tough so you need to give all of your effort even if you're not artistic. Class tends to be repetitive, and you do the same exact things for homework as well.

Heather was a wonderful professor who was very educated in her field. However, the photo lectures were VERY dry. She is a bit more old-fashioned in her techniques and doesn't give much feedback on projects which is frustrating. She seems "too busy" for the class. However, it is not difficult to pass and I feel like I learned how to photograph.

HEATHER IS THE BEST PROF EVER. I've been in her class several semesters in a row now and she's honestly the best instructor I've had by far. She really, genuinely cares about her students and pushes you to be the best artist you can be. She constantly provides support and inspiration for projects. Love u Heather xoxoxoxo

I really liked Heather and the class, She's very nice and laid back, really analyzes every students work and believes in every student. She has a great artistic ability, however seems uninterested in some of the "book" material of the class. its very easy to get an A, creative + artistic students will easily excel. I learned a lot about my camera!

Heather is one of the best, if not the best, instructor I've had at Ohio State. She has a tremendous amount of belief in her students to do great things and make great art. She has high expectations, but not outrageous. She made me feel so cared for as a student and artist. She makes you work for an A, but offers TONS of extra credit.

She's awesome. Very helpful. Hears out Every student, answers every question. She doesn't hand out A's on homework when she knows you can do better, but easy A with effort. She wants everyone to talk when doing critiques. But she's so chill & nice. She will help with your ideas for projects. Not huge deal if u 4get something, can bring it next time

No textbook needed, but had to buy a good amount of art supplies. A GEC you should only take if you're interested in art. So much effort needed for the homework in this class, but the teacher was fun to talk to.

Sean seems cool and whatnot, but never grades you until the finals so don't be surprised, he almost never gives A's.Also  there is no way to know what your grade is until it is posted on your grades after the finals
No Comments

Sean's not concerned with how skilled you are, just if you put in effort and have good ideas. He's really helpful and gives good feedback if you ask for it. Attendance is mandatory, but it's the art department's requirement, not Sean's. He doesn't really care if you miss class occasionally. I took two of his classes I liked him so much. Very cool.

Sean consistently encouraged the whole class to work harder and he introduced us to new artists. Attendance  and participation = very important. The theme: to recognize and work with the relationship between work and play. He ended the class early and his grading rubric was unclear imo.
Amy is an outstanding artist, and she works very hard to teach others to be like her.

attendance is mandatory only because it the only way you get work done. you also WILL have to come in on your free time but its a really fun and relaxed environment. Brandon is a really great teacher!!
Charlie was a good guy and really wanted to help everyone. I think he ran a good, structured class.

Hate him.  First of all, I thought we'd be doing storyboarding in this class, and we didn't do any of that, so that sucked.  Second, I hate Charlie Roberts.  He's a real jack ass.  He's lazy.  He was late a lot.  Sometimes he took points off on my projects, and when I asked him about it, he seemed like he was making up reasons on the spot. HATE HIM

Really encourages students who show effort or novel techniques. She lets you make your work or style be completely your own. She will encourage students to go beyond their current boundaries. Made class exciting to go to.

Instructor Baer is really into life drawing, her enthusiasm is contagious! Her weakness is that she does not communicate clearly. She offers really generalized feedback, her suggestion for improvement in her class is "don't be generic". I appreciate that she is challenging students, but she needs to offer more complete and technical feedback.
I enjoyed Ginnie as a teacher, but I felt that the class could have been more challenging and technically based. I feel like you should know the basics before risking experimentation.

Art 370 is Beginning Life Drawing and professor Baer is so into drawing. She made the class fun and interesting and gave personal attention to anyone who needed it. On the flip side, she may assume the students know more than they really do ablut the subject. I worked hard in this class, and my grades reflected my lack of drawing ability.
Fun class. Nice instructor. Had fun in his class. Just come to class with your creativity cap on and you'll learn a lot.

Coming to class was the worst part of my day. She treated us like 3 year olds and did 3975 demos that were 2 hours long about 'how to glue 2 pieces of paper together'. she picked favorites. on the first day she'll ask you why you r taking the class and you can't say bc it was a requirement or she'll get mad. She wore ugly skirts.
Fun class, but expect vague directions. Often found many students confused by her instructions with little clarification. She's really cool though. Treated her more like a friend than a teacher.
The projects were very time consuming. Overall a fun class, she's very helpful and treats you like more of a friend
This class should be renamed Scrap Paper 101. Her lectures were truly awful and mind-numbingly boring. The work was not hard, but it was time-consuming and generally useless.

Fun class, but there is A LOT to do. i often found myself frustrated with the inability to be completely creative, as many of the assignments are very specific, and sometimes, unclear until the very end. Still a blast, and fairly laid back.
Clare is a very cool teacher. She never answers a question, even if very basic, in a way that makes a student feel stupid. She has lots of personality which makes her classes lots of fun.
Knows art/design really well. Easy to get along with.

A decent teacher. Covers the technical basics for exam purposes, but other than that projects and critiques are virtually a free-for-all. Most of his artistic focus in class is on things for entertainment and nothing that pertains to the class content whatsoever. take it as you will, it's the hardest-easiest class i've taken.

He is awesome! His class was way too different from any other class that I have ever taken. He teaches differently, shows lot of videos and we had lot of fun discussing ideas. Very approachable and flexible with deadlines. Highly recommend if someone is looking to take a fun filled photography class. Good human being.

Matt is really interested in teaching his students about more than just photography. He helps you with ideas and gets really excited when you put in a lot of effort, and when we have intense class discussions about projects. I would definitely suggest that everyone takes his class! And he makes a delicious baked ziti for the review sessions!!

I loved this class and Matt! He taught us without it seeming like a class. He was generally interested in making amazing photography. He wanted everyone to understand how to work the camera, but was more interested in helping people be creative. I loved it. His alter-ego is Matt Mascaro..

Danielle is genuinely interested in each student in the class. She appreciates everyones different styles and values your opinion. This is definitely not an easy A, and requires A LOT of time spent outside class. Also, supplies needed to get started can cost about $150-$200. Buy the book off amazon (you do use it) and it will be no more than $10.
real awesome.
No Comments

Micah was a very nice and easy going professor. He didn't accept laziness and was very helpful if you needed it. This class is VERY expensive however, in fact I probably spent close to $500 on supplies alone. Wants you to have gouache paint, which is never clearly instructed on how to use it, so you will probably go though many tubes like our class

Micah is extremely helpful and always seems to understand your vision for your work. It is definitely not an easy A and he grades very picky because he sees no excuse for uneven mounting or excessive rubber cement. Attendance is manditory as is with all the foundation studies but he is so gorgeous in his tight jeans it makes it hard not to go ;)

I recommend any, and ALL classes she is teaching. the assignments were fun and I learned wayy more useful-knowledge.  in the 2 classes of her's (350 & 208)than i have in most of my classes. Very inspiring person; encourages "free thought". Also, she has "made-it", as an artist, in the big business world, so she has endless advice 4 starving artists

Sky was really laid back and it was always an enjoyable class. the assignments were always able to be done in class so little to no homework. Sky doesn't claim to be a photoshop whiz, but she is pretty helpful.
No Comments

Had her for hand-building ceramics and although I didn't care about ceramics she made it fun enough. And I went to class just to see her cause she's cool as hell and hot. Can you ask out a teacher after you're done with their class?
it's hard to focus in class when I am staring into her eyes longingly.
I have had Jaime for advanced photo and photo tech. He is awesome and I definitely recommend him. He also has a lot of knowledge behind his teaching.
I love Jamie Kennedy. He is very soft spoken and precious. His work is really awesome, but you have to ask him to see it. I agree that he is great with the ladies.

Jamie was challenging but fun. I loved the way he viewed the art world. You won't do well in his class if you don't try hard. But you will excel if you challenge yourself and spend tons of time on the projects. Mass amounts of time + quality work = an A.
Interesting class, for the most part. Very helpful and willing to stay after class to answer questions. The worst part was all the student presentations: after 3 or 4 out of 25, it got rather old.
Great sense of humor and quite the angelic voice.  Excellent with the ladies.
Cool guy. Very helpful. Take his class.

A good professor, has a great outlook on photography and makes the assingments are fun and interesting. Has an idealist approach. Very friendly. Would recommend this class for the GEC for Ohio State. It is a fun class.

The class is made up of 300 points. 100 midterm, 100 final, and 100 attendance. There are 2 classes a week (45 min) and you get 5 points for attending each class. You have to sign the attendance sheet and I would recommend staying b/c it is the ONLY way to pass. I got an A but the few sessions I signed in and left, I missed those points on the exam
if you enjoy taking an Intro To Art class taught by a man with a monotone and NO passion for art, take this class.  DREADED going every session.

Casey is a good professor, I just hated attending this class because it was boring. The subject matter was a lot more interesting than some classes but this was a 2 credit class and was only 48min twice a week, so I didn't feel like driving to OSU for it. Attendance is manditory (5 points per class, total of 100 points), so sign the sheet and stay.
Love, love, love Casey! Hes great about giving feedback and is so helpful in class. One of the most interesting teachers I've had at OSU so far!

I was interested in sculpture, until I took this class. Casey is a fun and interesting person. He is not very good at giving feedback before critiques, but will give you plenty of feedback AFTER grades are handed out. I asked plenty of questions and still feel like I learned little or nothing more about sculpture.
i love this man. he is such an excellent teacher. i miss him & his class now that it's over, LOL.

Casey is by far the best art teacher I've ever had. He's very helpful, fun to be around, and shows a genuine interest in you as a person and your artwork. If you are interested in taking an art class that he is teaching, TAKE IT! Rearrange your entire schedule if you have to! It will be worth it. :)

He is really fun, knowledgeable, and funny! He talks to you about your ideas before you start working a lot, which is very helpful. He is not afraid to be honest and puts forth a lot of positive criticism. Great teacher.
No Comments

Dr.Clemens is very thorough in covering the material, and has reasonable expectations of his students. Anatomy is difficult because of the vast amount of material, so how much you learn depends a lot upon your own diligence. Dr Clemens can't make his students study, but for those who do, (even a little) his lectures and labs solidify your knowledge

Worst teacher, only teacher who makes you buy RIVES paper, uses obscure language to hide the fact that any opinion he gives can niether be right or wrong. Grading system is subjective, if you have no drawing skill I highly advise you to choose a different teacher. gives very poor instructions. Note:i did well in this class, this is not bitter reven
Incredibly helpful and patient. He made me feel comfortable with drawing, thought it was my first art class. I would definitely recommend him.
in a 3 hour class with him.. i would rather shoot myself in the foot.  wears brown every single day.
Worst professor experience yet.  He doesn't know how to teach, makes stuff up on the fly (ambiguos material), and grades based on a "check plus - check minus" system.

I took her digital manipulation course. Her teaching skills are poor. She slightly charismatic which is deceiving but she leaves you in the dust. I already knew photoshop before this class. I don't understand how anyone learned with her teaching the class. Find another teaching if you have to take it.
Can we please  have a flash only class?
needs to slow down
He is extreamly attractive which made it easy to get up and go to class! He is very down to earth and willing to help! ipods and such are welcome in his classroom while making art. Loved the class!
I loved this class.  Ryan is the best teacher ever.... and what a HOTTIE!! There aren't enough peppers to explain how hot he is! His plaid shirts make him look like a hot artist lumberjack.
Very hot!
INSANE, 10 projects, 1 final that was 50% of your grade and in 10 weeks. I never have workd so hard. Good prof with high energy.
Good guy; interesting class, but I believe he left OSU.
Projects were hard, I spent 24hours on one. Overall Prof. Peterson kicks it up a notch, and is always willing to help, and rocked my world and everyone in my class.
Herb is a very passionate man and he inspires you to be passionate about image making!
If only all college classes could be this great. At first I was a bit scared at the work amount, but Herb made it all too enjoyable!

This was my favorite class at OSU. Herb is really interested in what he teaches and helping his students make great art projects, while not worrying so much about grades. He's very  approachable and keep the class interesting.
The best class I have ever taken at OSU. Professor Peterson made every class worth being at. Not your average GEC.
Great Teacher. Very excited about photography and art. I would definitely take another class with Herb. The class itself is challenging (not easy), but very rewarding.

I took Herb's Intro to Digital Photography class and had a blast. I at first thought I would learn a lot about my camera, but soon began to think more about art and how I am able to make art by using my camera. Herb was very nice and open to all forms of thinking. I would reccomend taking this class with him, you'll love it!
great sense of humor! I loved him
He is funny and easy-going about some things, but he has some inappropriate teaching policies.  Extremely difficult grader, and expects students to do more than they are capable of in the time given.

Chris was very helpful, yet at the same time pushed us to think for ourselves and solve our own problems.  Expect to put in a lot of work outside of class to complete your projects.  Critiques were very helpful.
coolest prof ever. fun, easy going, interesting, hilarious
